content: in this legal case the court ruled in favor of the plaintiffs and ordered the dissolution of a community property the property was divided into two lots with one lot given to the plaintiffs and the other to the defendant the courtappointed expert estimated the propertys value to be 360000 euros the plaintiffs agreed to the division plan proposed by the expert however the court decided that drawing lots for equal allocation was not applicable in this case instead the court considered the defendants longterm habitation of the property and assigned them a specific lot the court also took into account the plaintiffs need for protection as they were living in different places and would face difficulties finding a new home the court ordered the parties to share the costs of the consultation fees the final ruling states that the community property will be dissolved and divided between the plaintiffs and the defendant with lot 1 going to the plaintiffs and lot 2 to the defendant both parties will be compensated for their court costs and the consulting fees will be split equally the judge made this decision on june 28 2013
